comment._content: The (Portland) Sunday Oregonian ran this photo, credited to Bain, on March 16, 1916, with the following caption: "The firemen of Tokio give exhibitions on festival days near the Shinobizu pond. It is rather different from the wall-climbing and rescue work of our own fire laddies. But, while its practical value in conquering flames does not appear, it is undoubtedly splendid training for the men." oregonnews.uoregon.edu/lccn/sn83045782/1916-03-19/ed-1/se... The location is probably misspelled and is Shinobazo pond, a very large pond in Tokyo's Ueno Park. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinobazu_Pond See also
